question: In the following equation representing <katex>$\beta$</katex> decay, the number of neutrons in the nucleus X is
<katex>${}_{83}^{210}Bi\rightarrow X+e^{-1}+\overline{V}$</katex>
explanation: In beta-minus decay, a neutron converts to a proton.
The mass number A (210) remains constant. The atomic number Z increases by 1.
Parent Z = 83 (Bi). Daughter X has Z = 84 (Polonium).
